details.description: If you have an obsessive compulsive disorder (OCD) you must tell DVLA - download the correct form to let them know
details.body:
You may need to tell DVLA if you have an obsessive compulsive disorder.

You can be fined up to £1,000 if you don’t tell DVLA about a medical condition that affects your driving. If you’re involved in an accident, you may be prosecuted.

Car or motorcycle licence

You only need to tell DVLA about your obsessive compulsive disorder if it affects your driving. Check with your doctor if you are unsure.

If your obsessive compulsive disorder affects your driving, you must tell DVLA. Fill in form M1 and send it to DVLA. The address on the form.

Download ‘M1 - Confidential medical information’ (PDF, 252KB)

Bus, coach or lorry licence

You only need to tell DVLA about your obsessive compulsive disorder if it affects your driving. Check with your doctor if you are unsure.

If your obsessive compulsive disorder affects your driving, you must tell DVLA. Fill in form M1V and send it to DVLA. The address is on the form.

Download ‘M1V - Confidential medical information’ (PDF, 243KB)
